title: Support receipt drag and drop on the `Home` page

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

body:
Let's add receipt drag and drop to the Home page, for consistency with the experience elsewhere in the app. The relevant product/design details are: - On drag, users only see the option to "Scan receipts" - On successful drop, we navigate them to the Reports > Expenses page. We'll highlight a `Scanning` row as well - If a user drags/drops an unsupported file format, we'll show the existing error modal for the same case (shown in various places throughout the app).
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @ShridharGoel

## Action Performed:

2. Log in with valid credentials
3. Create 2+ workspaces (e.g. "Workspace A" and "Workspace B")
4. Enable time tracking on both (Settings > Workspace > More features > Time tracking)
5. Force-close and reopen the app (triggers fresh OpenApp)
6. Tap FAB (+) > Create expense > Time tab
7. Select "Workspace A"  and proceed creating expense
8. Tap FAB (+) > Create expense > Time tab
9. Select o"Workspace B"  and proceed creating expense

## Expected Result:
Both workspaces appear in the workspace selection list and user is able to create a time expense

## Actual Result:
Both workspaces appear in the workspace selection list and user is able to create a time expense. One of both time expenses is automatically filled with "Labor" category

Unknown

**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** Honor x6b/ Android 14
**App Component:** Workspace Settings

## Action Performed:
Precondition: Use expensifail account (+), has a WS, and has enabled "Travel" feature

1. Click on the Travel menu option > Let's Go
2. Verify you are prompted to add a company address 
3. Set the following Company Address "548 Market St San Francisco, CA 94104, United States"
4. Click "Save"
5. Check the terms box and continue
6. Verify the user is redirected to https://staging.travel.expensify.com/  inside of a webview in the New Expensify app.
-> Result: travel.expensify.com opens in an external browser
7. Turn back to app
8. Tap on "Manage travel" section
9. Verify the user is redirected to https://staging.travel.expensify.com/  inside of a webview in the New Expensify app.
-> Result: travel.expensify.com open in the app’s webview

## Expected Result:
travel.expensify.com should open within the app’s webview without redirecting to an external browser.

## Actual Result:
travel.expensify.com opens in an external browser tab instead of an in-app webview. The page can be accessed in the app by returning to the app and tapping Manage travel.

## Workaround:
Unknown

title: Allow updating NetSuite tokens without resetting connection configuration

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
# Problem When a user needs to update their NetSuite token credentials — whether due to an authentication error, token rotation, or any other reason — the App calls `ConnectPolicyToNetSuite`, which triggers an `initConnection` job on the backend. This resets all user configuration (subsidiary, export destinations, mappings, custom segments, etc.). There is no way to update NetSuite credentials without wiping out the entire connection setup. Users are forced to reconfigure everything from scratch just to rotate tokens. This feature exists in OldDot: # Solution The backend now supports a new API command `UpdateNetSuiteTokens` that validates and updates credentials, then triggers a sync — all while preserving existing config. The App needs to use this new command when the user already has an existing NetSuite connection and is updating their credentials. The current UI surface for this is the token input form shown when a connection has `isAuthenticationError === true`. In that flow, the App should call `UpdateNetSuiteTokens` instead of `ConnectPolicyToNetSuite`. Fresh first-time connections should continue using `ConnectPolicyToNetSuite`. # Changes needed ## 1. Add write command — `src/libs/API/types.ts` - Add `UPDATE_NETSUITE_TOKENS: 'UpdateNetSuiteTokens'` to the `WRITE_COMMANDS` enum (near the other `UPDATE_NETSUITE_*` entries). - Add its type mapping using the existing `ConnectPolicyToNetSuiteParams` type (same parameters: `policyID`, `netSuiteAccountID`, `netSuiteTokenID`, `netSuiteTokenSecret`). ## 2. Add action function — `src/libs/actions/connections/NetSuiteCommands.ts` - Add and export an `updateNetSuiteTokens(policyID, credentials)` function. - It should mirror `connectPolicyToNetSuite` (same optimistic data for sync progress) but use `WRITE_COMMANDS.UPDATE_NETSUITE_TOKENS`. ## 3. Update form submission — `src/pages/workspace/accounting/netsuite/NetSuiteTokenInput/substeps/NetSuiteTokenInputForm.tsx` - Import `updateNetSuiteTokens` from `NetSuiteCommands`. - Import `isAuthenticationError` from `@libs/actions/connections`. - Import `usePolicy` from `@hooks/usePolicy` (the `SubStepWithPolicy` type only provides `policyID`, not the full policy object). - Call `usePolicy(policyID)` to get the policy. - In the connectPolicy callback: if `isAuthenticationError(policy, CONST.POLICY.CONNECTIONS.NAME.NETSUITE)` is true, call `updateNetSuiteTokens`; otherwise call `connectPolicyToNetSuite` as before. # How to verify 1. **Token update scenario:** With a NetSuite connection that has configured settings, simulate an auth error (set `isAuthenticationError: true` on the connection's `lastSync` in Onyx) → re-enter credentials → verify network request goes to `UpdateNetSuiteTokens` (not `ConnectPolicyToNetSuite`). 2. **Fresh connection scenario:** Connect NetSuite for the first time → verify the request still goes to `ConnectPolicyToNetSuite`. 3. Run `npm run typecheck`, `npm run prettier`, and lint on changed files. Related to https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/598576
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @truph01

## Action Performed:
Preconditon:
- Workspace has per diem rates.

1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Go to Workspaces tab.
3. Click 3-dot menu on the workspace > Duplicate workspace.
4. Click Next > Continue.
5. Go to self DM.
6. Click + > Create expense > Per diem.
7. Select the duplicated workspace.
8. Click RHP back button.

## Expected Result:
The duplicated workspace will be marked with checkmark because it is selected.

## Actual Result:
The original workspace is marked with checkmark when the duplicated workspace is selected.

Unknown

labels.name: External

labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.17-9
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Unable to reproduce)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @marianaabussamra 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770916102117589)

## Action Performed:

1. Log into New Expensify on Web
2. Navigate to the Reports page
3. Look at the left-hand navigation menu and locate the Explore section
4. Attempt to access the Reports tab under the Explore section (when it is below the visible portion of the menu)
5. Try to scroll the left-hand menu using mouse wheel, trackpad, or keyboard, and note that no scrollbar is displayed

## Expected Result:
The left-hand Explore menu should support vertical scrolling when its contents exceed the visible height.
A scrollbar (or equivalent scroll affordance) should be visible so users and assistive technologies can discover that additional items are available.
Users should be able to scroll down and access the Reports tab under the Explore section
## Actual Result:
The left-hand Explore menu does not scroll, and no scrollbar is displayed.
Users cannot reach the Reports tab under Explore when it is below the fold, effectively blocking access to that navigation item from this view.
## Workaround:
Unknown
## Platforms:
Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome and Edge
- [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.18-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ted@expensify.com **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856: 9cbd5d9f6968db8c-SJC **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/595045#issuecomment-3884615330 **Issue reported by:** @twisterdotcom **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/595045#issuecomment-3884615330 ## Action Performed: Precondition: Have an approved reimbursable report on a workspace with a CorPay reimbursement account set on it. Have a deposit account set that is not USD. 1. Amend your deposit account so the name doesn't match your account details 2. After approval, have the VBA admin pay the report 3. Wait for the bounce back 4. See the reportAction show the return reason in Expensify Classic but not in New Expensify: ## Expected Result: The return reason should show for in both platforms. It should read: >couldn't process the payment: $returnReason When no returnReason is available, it should default to the same return reason we send via email in [https://github.com/Expensify/Web-Expensify/blob/main/lib/Notification/ACHCreditBounce.php](https://github.com/Expensify/Web-Expensify/blob/main/lib/Notification/ACHCreditBounce.php?rgh-link-date=2026-02-11T13%3A55%3A20.000Z) which is: >couldn't process the payment due to an incorrect routing/account number or closed account ## Actual Result: We always show `due to a bank account issue`. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-5133/folder/13176744/41237148/1186707000
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2250@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace.
Prerequisite 2: Distance expense previously created so waypoints are already saved.
1. Open the Expensify app.
2. Open any workspace chat.
3. Turn off internet connection.
4. Create a distance expense with "Map" option.
5. Open the report of the just created expense.
6. Note that next steps message displays "Waiting for you to add expenses" instead of "Waiting for you to submit expenses"

## Expected Result:
After creating a distance expense while in offline mode, next step message displayed should be "Waiting for you to submit expenses"

## Actual Result:
After creating a distance expense while in offline mode, next step message displayed is "Waiting for you to add expenses", despite report already having an expense in it.

## Workaround:
Unknown
